Class EmployeeDAO

java.lang.Object
database.EmployeeDAO
public class EmployeeDAO extends Object
The EmployeeDAO class provides methods for accessing and modifying employee data stored in the database. It handles database operations such as retrieving all employees, adding new employees, updating their active status, and fetching a single employee by ID.

  • Method Details

    • getAllEmployees

      public List<Employee> getAllEmployees()
      Retrieves a list of all employees from the database.
      Returns:
      a List of Employee objects representing all employees; an empty list if no employees are found or an error occurs

    • addEmployee

      public boolean addEmployee(String name, String position, String password)
      Adds a new employee to the database.
      Parameters:
      name - the employee's name
      position - the employee's position (e.g., cashier, manager)
      password - the employee's password
      Returns:
      true if the employee was successfully added; false otherwise

    • updateEmployeeActiveStatus

      public boolean updateEmployeeActiveStatus(int id, boolean active)
      Updates the active status of a specific employee in the database.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the employee to update
      active - true to set the employee as active; false to deactivate them
      Returns:
      true if the update was successful; false otherwise

    • getEmployeeById

      public Employee getEmployeeById(int id)
      Retrieves an employee's information from the database based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the employee to retrieve
      Returns:
      an Employee object if the employee exists; null otherwise
